1.title: Episode #3.1

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

1.plot: Beating inflation is discussed in the Season 3 premiere. Also: astronaut Dan Barry on profiting from the final frontier.

2.title: Episode #3.2

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

2.plot: A homeowner who's underwater on her mortgage; financial basic training for soldiers. Also: taking advantage of 3D printing; finding joy in little things.

3.title: Episode #3.3

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

3.plot: Why stocks shouldn't be more exciting. Also: getting back on the right financial path; protecting one's financial privacy; reducing everyday stresses.

4.title: Episode #3.4

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

4.plot: A financial primer for the troops; where to find seed money for a new business; the strength in numbers. Also: facing one's fears.

5.title: Episode #3.5

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

5.plot: Whether it's wiser to save for a child's college education or one's retirement. Also: investment advice; the secret to immortality; and the benefits of a good mental workout.

6.title: Episode #3.6

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

6.plot: Advice for a couple contemplating marriage: wait. Also: investing in rental properties; cars that drive themselves; and the benefits of giving back.

7.title: Episode #3.7

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

7.plot: A woman with no credit history; why change is good. Also: saving for retirement; profiting from 4D printing.

8.title: Episode #3.8

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

8.plot: Changing retirement investments. Also: the future and robots; money and happiness.

9.title: Episode #3.9

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

9.plot: Owning a home outright vs. a mortgage. Also: celebrities on the one thing money can't buy.

10.title: Episode #3.10

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

10.plot: Financial advisor Ric Edelman teaches a dad about the high cost of higher education; explores the cyber-securing of your financial information, and Jean Edelman explains the importance of clear communication.

11.title: Episode #3.11

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

11.plot: Whether real estate is a good investment; the technology sector; how change is good.

12.title: Episode #3.12

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

12.plot: The transition to a green economy; the transformation of the health-care industry; early retirement.

13.title: Episode #3.13

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

13.plot: A man who can't save despite working three jobs. Also: sending one's kids to college vs. saving for retirement; whether robots will eliminate human jobs; and the impact of too much clutter.

14.title: Episode #3.14

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

14.plot: Investment advisor Ric Edelman teaches a college student how to understand the value of her degree; explores whether there's big bucks in tiny technology; and Jean Edelman shares her perspective on "catching the wave."

15.title: Episode #3.15

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

15.plot: Financial advisor Ric Edelman looks at investing today into tomorrow's energy resources; advises on how to save for tomorrow while living in the present; and Jean Edelman provides tips on balancing your schedule.

16.title: Episode #3.16

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

16.plot: The pros and cons of investing in real estate. Also: medical technologies worth investing in.

17.title: Episode #3.17

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

17.plot: When to dip into a retirement nest egg to buy a home. Also: Moore's law; choosing the right words.

1.title: Steps to Create a Retirement Roadmap

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

1.plot: Avoiding mental accounting mistakes, simple steps to create a retirement road map and Ric interviews CNBC financial host Maria Bartiromo.

2.title: Umbrella Lia­bil­ity Insur­ance

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

2.plot: Host Ric Edelman explains the importance of umbrella liability insurance, the difference between a trust and a will, and interviews legendary newsman Sam Donaldson.

3.title: Sav­ing for Col­lege

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

3.plot: Ric discusses saving for college, the best time to take the required minimum distribution (RMD) from your IRA and interviews celebrity divorce lawyer Raoul Felder.

4.title: Credit Cards

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

4.plot: Ric discusses how to use credit cards the right way, when to exercise your company's stock options, provides helpful tips on how to pay for college and interviews Kim Clark of US News and World Report.

5.title: The Pit­falls of Pay­ing Off a Mort­gage Early

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

5.plot: Host Ric Edelman explains the pitfalls of paying off a mortgage early; interviews entrepreneur baker Warren Brown of CakeLove; answers questions about paying for college, coordinating your retirement accounts and taking on debt in order to invest. He also discusses how to pick the right mortgage loan and answers questions from his radio audience.

6.title: IRS Refund Checks

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

6.plot: Host Ric Edelman explains the downside of receiving an IRS refund check; discusses the tensions that erupt over a spouse's spending habits and interviews hip-hop mogul Russell Simmons. He also answers questions from a seminar, talks about gold, and fields a question from Miami Beach.

7.title: Retirement Plans

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

7.plot: Host Ric Edelman wonders how many people really invest the maximum amount in their retirement plans, explains how to talk to children about finances, and interviews former US Comptroller General David Walker. He also fields questions about the tough economy, talks about buying investment condos in Florida, and addresses other topics that have come up during his seminars and weekly radio shows.

8.title: Intuition About Money

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

8.plot: Join Ric Edelman as he explains how intuition about money can land people in trouble, reveals the key to happiness during retirement, and hears from former US Comptroller General David Walker about what ordinary citizens can do to fight government over-spending and debt. Ric also fields questions from his seminar audience, his weekly radio show, and people on the street.

9.title: Elder Abuse

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

9.plot: Host Ric Edelman discusses the problem of financial scam artists preying on elderly people, answers audience questions on the cost of law school and the different types of insurance available, and discusses the current state of the 401K with Dallas Salisbury of the Employee Benefit Research Institute. Ric also fields questions on stock market volatility and what Medicare will, and will not, cover in retirement.

10.title: What is an IRA?

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

10.plot: Host Ric Edelman sits down with Kim Clark, US News & World Report editor, to discuss ways to pay for college. He also explains common misconceptions about IRAs, how to ensure real satisfaction in retirement and the crucial importance of re-balancing a stock portfolio.

11.title: Victim of Fraud

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

11.plot: Ric Edelman's guest, Rene Renick of the National Network to End Domestic Violence, discusses financial literacy as a way out for a battered spouse. In addition, Edelman takes a question from the Man on the Street camera about paying down credit cards, counsels a radio caller on dealing with thousands of dollars of debt and points out "doing nothing" is sometimes better than selling stocks in a falling market.

12.title: Two Stocks

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

12.plot: Nolan Ryan, Baseball Hall of Fame pitcher and President of the Texas Rangers, joins Ric to provide insights on the financial side of baseball. In addition, Ric explains the importance of selling a winning stock, teaching children about money and avoiding a bad deal on a leased car.

13.title: Number of Bathrooms

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

13.plot: Host Ric Edelman explains why the bank sees a house very differently than a homeowner does, how much to save prior to having children and discusses entrepreneurship with former AOL executive Ted Leonsis. Edelman also counsels a radio caller on helping her sister find housing, fields questions on mortgages from a live audience and cautions against letting politics influence investment decisions.

14.title: Have a Will?

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

14.plot: Ric explains the importance of wills; answers questions about saving for college and buying a house; continues with part 2 of his interview with former executive and sports team owner Ted Leonsis about the enduring meaning of sports teams...plus much more!

15.title: Setting Goals

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

15.plot: Ric explains how setting and meeting goals can help improve your financial future; answers TV studio audience question about caring for an aging parent; continues his conversation with baseball legend Nolan Ryan about the economics of baseball...plus much more!

16.title: Jack and Jill

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

16.plot: Ric reveals how compound interest can make eight years of saving more lucrative than 40 years of saving; warns a radio show caller against bad advice from his banker; interviews Bob Barnett, Washington, D.C.'s lawyer to political stars and authors about the art of negotiation.

17.title: Goldilocks

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

17.plot: Ric uses the story of Goldilocks to illustrate the challenges of knowing when to take money from an IRA: not too soon, not too late and not too much but "just right"; answers questions about long-term care insurance; interviews author Carol Joynt (Innocent Spouse) about the financial nightmare she faced after her husband died - a $3 million tax bill!

18.title: Kids and Money

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

18.plot: Ric shares tips on how to teach children about handling money; answers questions about whole life insurance; provides 18 questions to ask when evaluating a financial advisor; and interviews Washington Post financial columnist Michelle Singletary. Plus much more!

19.title: Individual Stocks

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

19.plot: Ric reveals the impor­tance of diver­si­fi­ca­tion in help­ing decrease the risk of buy­ing indi­vid­ual stocks; answers ques­tions about munic­i­pal bonds; explains what to do when home­own­ers owe more than the value of their house; talks to Wash­ing­ton Post finan­cial colum­nist Michelle Sin­gle­tary in part two of their inter­view where they talk about the basic mis­takes many fam­i­lies make plan­ning for the future and man­ag­ing their spending.

20.title: Cash Reserves

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

20.plot: Ric discuses cash reserves; financial schemes; unexpected windfalls. Also: negotiation techniques are discussed with lawyer Bob Barnett.

21.title: Lending to Family

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

21.plot: Lending to friends and family; saving to attend college in another country; becoming a landlord. Also: sports agent David Falk is interviewed.

2.plot: Ric Edelman explores how the costs of flying in a private jet apply to everyday situations like leasing a new car. Ric also gives advice about 401(k)s and speaks with fitness guru Denise Austin about the discipline needed to achieve financial fitness.

15.title: Episode #2.15

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

15.plot: Ric Edelman answers financial questions about how to help your child establish a good credit rating, paying off student loans without going broke, and how to pick an investment advisor. Plus, actor/playwright Chazz Palminteri joins Ric and discusses growing up in the Bronx and what it took to make it to the top.

16.title: Episode #2.16

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

16.plot: Financial planner Ric Edelman explores the pitfalls of buying a vacation home and tells how to locate lost stock price information from a previous employer.

17.title: Episode #2.17

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

17.plot: Financial advisor Ric Edelman uncorks the risks of investing in fine wine, talks with top financial advisors about fixed annuities, and sits down with Professor Jeremy Siegel of the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School of Business to discuss the past 200 years of stock prices.

18.title: Episode #2.18

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

18.plot: Financial advisor Ric Edelman explains how you can take an exotic sports car for a drive without being taken to the cleaners, interviews legendary boxing promoter Bob Arum, and dissects how to evaluate a financial advisor.

19.title: Episode #2.19

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

19.plot: Financial planner Ric Edelman explores the importance of professional guidance with a shark-fishing captain, and visits TV's Pawn Stars Rick, Corey and "The Old Man."

20.title: Episode #2.20

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

20.plot: Investment advisor Ric Edelman looks at the surprisingly reasonable price of a nanny, chats with baseball player Ken Kendricks about the reality of playing in the majors, and answers a variety of questions about personal finance.

21.title: Episode #2.21

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

21.plot: determine if retirement money should be invested in collectibles, dishes with Variety Inc. president Neil Stiles about the behind-the-scenes tales of show business, and delves into the funnier, financial side of dating.

22.title: Episode #2.22

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

22.plot: Investment advisor Ric Edelman breaks down what it will cost to bottle your own wine, answers a question about financial pitfalls for young adults, and joins forces with Elmo from Sesame Street to teach kids about money.

23.title: Episode #2.23

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

23.plot: Financial planner Ric Edelman checks out young entrepreneurs at one of Silicon Valley's hot startups, gleans insights from top restaurateurs, and advises a caller about the dangers of a sudden financial windfall.

24.title: Episode #2.24

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

24.plot: Financial advisor Ric Edelman launches into a conversation with a rocket scientist about the economics of mining on the moon, and provides down-to-earth advice on owning a racehorse, banking cash reserves and doing your own estate planning.

25.title: Episode #2.25

episode of.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (TV Series 2011– )

25.plot: Financial planner Ric Edelman investigates the balance between risk and reward hundreds of feet above the ground, answers a question about the safety of foreign bonds, and takes a look at the world of digital media with Variety Inc. president Neil Stiles.

locations: Great Falls Park - 9200 Old Dominion Drive, McLean, Virginia, USA
imdb.plot outline: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman will premiere nationally on public television stations in the Spring of 2011. In these 26 half-hour episodes, Ric will entertain and educate you about personal finance, covering investments, retirement, paying for college, handling mortgages, supporting aging parents and much more. Ric's financial savvy will engage you both intellectually and emotionally, and provide you with the practical information you need to achieve financial success.
imdb.title: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman
akas: The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman (United States)
plot: Ric will entertain and educate you about personal finance, covering investments, retirement, paying for college, handling mortgages, supporting aging parents and much more.::3 Roads Communications

_The Truth About Money with Ric Edelman_ (qv) will premiere nationally on public television stations in the Spring of 2011. In these 26 half-hour episodes, Ric will entertain and educate you about personal finance, covering investments, retirement, paying for college, handling mortgages, supporting aging parents and much more. Ric's financial savvy will engage you both intellectually and emotionally, and provide you with the practical information you need to achieve financial success.::3 Roads Communications
